page.title: 06LIFE STYLES
page.content: Mrs Hood, Mansell Meadows, Brailsford North. Decided at 40 plus that town life was not for them & moved here with their 3 daughters.Treated a little warily at first but determined to settle in & get along with everyone - this has happened. Mr Wood made redundant, has started taxi service with Government Enterprise grant. Prop erty is a small holding with 2 cows, lambs,chickens 2 ponies,dogs. Hay made & used for food. Radio & telephone are lifelines. Mobile library calls once a fortnight with books & tapes. Milk delivered twice a week, bulk shopping done in Derby or Ashbourne once a mth. Stocks must be kept as winter snows can cut them off for five days or more Water is piped from nearest farmer, they have electricity, burn wood & solid fuel. Low c.c. motor cycles used by daughters
